name: biomni-perform-cosinor-analysis
title: Biomni: Perform Cosinor Analysis
description: Performs cosinor analysis on physiological time series data to characterize circadian rhythms.
content:
Overview

Performs cosinor analysis on physiological time series data to characterize circadian rhythms. This tool fits a sinusoidal model to rhythmic biological data, extracting key circadian parameters including amplitude, acrophase (peak time), and mesor (rhythm-adjusted mean), which are essential for studying biological clocks and temporal patterns in physiology.

Input Parameters

  • time_data (required): Array of time points (hours) for physiological measurements
  • physiological_data (required): Array of physiological values (e.g., temperature, hormone levels, activity) corresponding to each time point
  • period (optional, default=24.0): Expected period of the rhythm in hours (24 for circadian)

Biological Use Case

This analysis is valuable for:

  • Characterizing circadian rhythms in body temperature, hormone secretion, and metabolism
  • Studying sleep-wake cycle disturbances and chronobiology
  • Evaluating shift work effects and jet lag on physiological rhythms
  • Assessing circadian clock gene expression patterns
  • Investigating seasonal rhythms and ultradian oscillations
  • Analyzing drug chronotherapy and optimal dosing times
  • Studying circadian disruption in disease (e.g., cancer, metabolic disorders)

Output

Returns comprehensive cosinor analysis including:

  • MESOR (Midline Estimating Statistic Of Rhythm): rhythm-adjusted mean
  • Amplitude: half the difference between peak and trough
  • Acrophase: time of peak in the fitted rhythm (hours)
  • Period: validated rhythm period
  • R-squared and p-value for rhythm detection
  • Fitted curve parameters and confidence intervals
  • Visualization plot with data points and fitted cosinor curve

Category

physiology
